Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel in a closed shape with a pot-mark on the outside that was incised after the vessel was fired. It shows possibly an animal facing to the right, with the head missing. Probably a feline or similar in a running, almost jumping pose. The vessel is wheel made with a pinkish self-slip and made of marl or other imported clay.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2F, levels 1-2, PMK47/9
